description.narrative: CPFL Energia is a holding company that controls three distribution companies and has majority ownership in several generation projects. CPFL Energia''s distribution companies serve approximately 5 million customers in 515 municipalities. Its generation companies have total nameplate capacity (operating and under construction) in excess of 4,200 MW, of which CPFL''s portion is 2,379 MW. The IFC investment will assist the company in the completion of its corporate restructuring process, implementation of new corporate governance policies, and preparation for an IPO on the Brazilian Novo Mercado and NYSE, expected to take place in 2003. Development Impacts and IFC''s Role IFC''s proposed investment will help the company to complete its corporate restructuring and to prepare it for the IPO on the Brazilian Novo Mercado and NYSE. CPFL Energia will be one of the few Brazilian energy companies to list on the NYSE. IFC''s participation would give comfort to domestic and international investors and will allow the company to access cheaper sources of capital on domestic and global capital markets. IFCs involvement will also help to make this company a highly visible example of the adoption of sustainable business practices in this sector in emerging markets. IFC''s involvement will also ensure the CPFL Energia''s adoption of environmental and social policies that are in line with the World Bank Group policies and global best practices.

name.narrative: CPFL Energia''s electricity distribution companies serve the state of Sao Paulo and the northern regions of state of Rio Grande Do Sul. Its existing generation assets are located in the states of Goias and the state of Sao Paulo. Its four new hydro projects are located in the state of Santa Catarina and the state of Rio Grande do Sul.
